jdm.name: Couchsurfing
jdm.notes: Cannot be deleted fully, reactivation is always available. Fill out the form and select 'I understand. Please delete my profile.'.

points.title: Couchsurfing keeps the license on your content, even after you close your account

topics.description: Copyright law gives you control over how your content (texts, photos, videos, etc.) can be used, by whom they can be distributed, modified, etc. Sometimes, online services need your permission to perform certain tasks with your content. That's why they ask you to grant them a copyright license. But sometimes, the copyright license is so broad, that your content can be exploited by others without asking you.

meta.license-for-this-file: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ or send a letter to Creative Commons, 444 Castro Street, Suite 900, Mountain View, California, 94041, .USA

topics.name: Scope of the copyright license
topics.subtitle: Do you grant only the necessary rights?
topics.title: Scope of the copyright license

tosdr.case: keep a license even after you close your account
tosdr.tldr:
"21.7 Survival. Sections 4.4 (Release), 5 (Member Conduct and 
Content), 6 (Submissions), 10 (Trademarks), 12 (Third-Party Content), 
15 (Member's Representations and Warranties), 16 (Disclaimer of 
Warranties), 17 (Limits on Liability), 18 (Indemnity), 20 (Disputes), 
and this Section 21 (Miscellaneous) shall survive any termination or 
expiration of these Terms." 
section 5 is the one that contains the license they get on your content.

points.title: Couchsurfing becomes the owner of ideas you give them

topics.description: The content and the data you generate on services online is usually subject to copyright law. When your data are collected by services, they can be considered personal data.  It means that it is your content, your data: you can decide.

example.bad: We get a license beyond the requirements to operate the service, so your data may be used for purposes you do not intend. We will still attribute ownership to you.
example.blocker: We become the owners of your data.
example.good: You license us to use your data only for the purpose of operating this service.

meta.license-for-this-file: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License. topics.name: Ownership
topics.subtitle: What happens with the content you generate on the service?
topics.title: Ownership

tosdr.case: they become the owner of ideas you give them
tosdr.tldr:
"If you provide a 
Submission, you agree that it is non-confidential (unless CouchSurfing 
states otherwise in writing) and shall become the sole property of 
CouchSurfing."

topics.name: User choice
topics.subtitle: How much can YOU decide?
topics.title: User choice

tosdr.tldr:
"You may opt out of receiving promotional emails from CouchSurfing by 
following the instructions in those emails or by adjusting the 
appropriate settings in your profile." - this means the default is that they will send you
promotional communications that you didn't ask them to send you.

you agree to follow them.

points.title: Terms may be changed at any time without advance notice

topics.description: Services need to evolve. But it is important that updating the service does not break the consentment with the user. Updates and changes to terms of service and privacy policy need to be properly noticed to users and to sollicit their agreement again.

meta.license-for-this-file: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ or send a letter to Creative Commons, 444 Castro Street, Suite 900, Mountain View, California, 94041, .USA

topics.name: Notice of Changing Terms
topics.subtitle: Are users notified when terms change? Are they given enough time to find out what changed and discuss this with each other before deciding whether to continue to use the service under the new terms?
topics.title: Notice of Changing Terms

tosdr.tldr: The service can change the terms of service at any time, even without notification to the user. New or updated terms are posted on their site but your continued use of the service is taken as acceptance of the new or changed terms.

points.title: The copyright license on user data is broader than necessary

topics.description: Copyright law gives you control over how your content (texts, photos, videos, etc.) can be used, by whom they can be distributed, modified, etc. Sometimes, online services need your permission to perform certain tasks with your content. That's why they ask you to grant them a copyright license. But sometimes, the copyright license is so broad, that your content can be exploited by others without asking you.

meta.license-for-this-file: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License. topics.name: Scope of the copyright license
topics.subtitle: Do you grant only the necessary rights?
topics.title: Scope of the copyright license

tosdr.tldr:
"5.3 Member Content License. If you post Member Content to our 
Services, you hereby grant us a perpetual, worldwide, irrevocable, 
non-exclusive, royalty-free and fully sublicensable license to use, 
reproduce, display, perform, adapt, modify, create derivative works 
from, distribute, have distributed and promote such Member Content in 
any form, in all media now known or hereinafter created and for any 
purpose, including without limitation the right to use your name, 
likeness, voice or identity."

points.title: Couchsurfing will pass your data on to the new company if they enter in a merger

topics.description: When you give your data to a company, you need to keep in mind that this company can get acquired by another company, with different policies. What happens in that case?

meta.license-for-this-file: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License. topics.name: Business Transfers
topics.subtitle: Is your data a business asset?
topics.title: Business Transfers

tosdr.case: may sell your data in merger
tosdr.tldr:
"Sharing of Information 
We do not share personal information about you with third parties 
except as follows: 
[...] 
In connection with, or during negotiations of, any merger, sale of 
company assets, financing or acquisition of all or a portion of our 
business to another company". The consensus on this thread is that this is standard practice, so does not merit negative points.

topics.title: Governance

tosdr.case: you are responsible for what you publish
tosdr.tldr:
"You are solely responsible for any Member Content that you submit, 
post or transmit via our Services. You agree not to post, upload to, 
transmit, distribute, store, create or otherwise publish through the 
Services, Member Content that we believe, in our sole discretion: 
(and then a list of reasons, like racism, nudity, drug use, copyright 
infringement, etc)

topics.description: Your account and your data are on their servers, so they control them. Which guarantee do you have that lawful content and lawful activity will not be censored or suspended?

topics.name: Suspension and Censorship
topics.subtitle: Can they end your use of the service at any time?
topics.title: Suspension and Censorship

tosdr.case: they can delete your account without prior notice and without a reason
tosdr.tldr:
"REPEAT INFRINGER POLICY 
In accordance with the Digital Millennium Copyright Act ("DMCA") and 
other applicable law, CouchSurfing has adopted a policy of 
terminating, in appropriate circumstances and in CouchSurfing's sole 
discretion, members who are deemed to be repeat infringers. 
CouchSurfing may also, in our sole discretion, limit access to the 
Services and/or terminate the accounts of any members who we believe 
may infringe any intellectual property rights of others, whether or 
not there is any repeat infringement."

points.title: You are not allowed to use a nick name

topics.description: The terms sometimes describe the level of logging and the level of data collection and which kinds of data the service is processing. Anonymity or the right to use a pseudonym can be very important for freedom of expression (e.g. for people exercising a certain profession, or people living in authoritarian regimes).

information when creating an account on CouchSurfing.

topics.name: Cookies
topics.subtitle: and related technologies
topics.title: Cookies

tosdr.case: third-party cookies, but with opt-out instructions
tosdr.tldr:
"Cookies 
Most web browsers are set to accept cookies by default. If you prefer, 
you can usually choose to set your browser to remove or reject browser 
cookies; however, our Services may not function properly if you do 
so."

topics.name: Anonymity and Tracking
topics.subtitle: Are you being spied on?
topics.title: Anonymity and Tracking

tosdr.case: tracking pixels used in service-to-user communication
tosdr.tldr:
We 
may automatically collect information using cookies, web beacons (also 
known as "gifs," "pixel tags" and "tracking pixels") and other 
tracking technologies to, among other things, improve our Services and 
your experience, monitor user activity, count visits, understand usage 
and campaign effectiveness and tell if an email has been opened and 
acted upon. For information about removing or rejecting cookies, 
please see "Your Information Choices" below."

points.title: Couchsurfing may retain your data after deactivation for legitimate business purposes

topics.description: Once you subscribe to the service, will you have the right to leave it and remove your data?

meta.license-for-this-file: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License. topics.name: Right to leave the service
topics.subtitle: To avoid lock-in and stay in control
topics.title: Right to leave the service

tosdr.tldr:
"may retain certain information as required by law, for legitimate 
business purposes and to protect member safety." They say they will hold data from already 
closed accounts in order to help them combat fraud on the platform.
